Methadone

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #


                    Context:

metadata.title: Erowid Methadone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Methadone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methadone | cid: 4095
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Methadone and drug tests.
Erowid name: methadone
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Methadone

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Methadone Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? YES Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 1-10 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Methadone does not show up in a basic opiate test that is part of the standard pre-employment drug test and which can detect heroin, codeine and morphine (and perhaps oxycodone, hydrocodone, and hydromorphone). A methadone specific test must be performed to detect methadone. This test is not uncommon and is part of the second tier "extended" test done by many companies. Though the published information we've found suggests that methadone is not detectable after a few days, we have received reports from methadone maintenance users that they have been found methadone-positive on urine screens for 10-30 days after their last dose.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information about methadone drug testing from Erowid's Chemicals Vault, explaining detection periods, the types of drug tests that include methadone, and clarifying that standard urine tests do not detect methadone unless a specific extended test is requested. It also notes variability in detection times and cautions that results may depend on individual factors.

metadata.title: Erowid Methadone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Methadone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methadone | cid: 4095
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Methadone and drug tests.
Erowid name: methadone
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

                    Context: 
                    This section appears at the end of Erowid's page on methadone drug testing, following details about test types and detection windows. It provides a disclaimer about the variability and sources of the drug testing information, clarifies factors influencing detection periods, and offers links to related resources.
